Package pieces

Class Rook

java.lang.Object
chess.Piece
pieces.Rook
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Rook
extends Piece
Class Rook A Rook is the representation of a rook chess piece, implementing the abstract methods declared in Piece.
Author:
Patrick Barry, Philip Murray
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • getString

      public java.lang.String getString()
      getString Method Returns ASCII representation of the Queen Used in Board.render method
      Specified by:
      getString in class Piece
      Returns:
      bR - If black Rook. wR - If white Rook.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(Position newpos, Piece promotion) throws IllegalMoveException
      moveTo Method This is the Rook's implementation of the moveTo method. Performs various legality checks on requested movement. If a check fails, an IllegalMoveException is thrown corresponding to the failed check. Move is applied on this Piece's ParentBoard.
      Specified by:
      moveTo in class Piece
      Parameters:
      newpos - - Position the Piece is moving to
      promotion - - Not used in Rook's implementation
      Throws:
      IllegalMoveException - - Cannot capture same-side Piece
      IllegalMoveException - - Cannot move through a Piece
      IllegalMoveException - - Move Vector does not match any of the allowed movement vectors for this Piece
